abstract: The government charged that executives throughout the company planned schemes to illegally market Bextra and other drugs.
snippet: The government charged that executives throughout the company planned schemes to illegally market Bextra and other drugs.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The pharmaceutical giant Pfizer agreed to pay $2.3 billion to settle civil and criminal allegations that it had illegally marketed its painkiller Bextra, which has been withdrawn.

headline.main: Pfizer Pays $2.3 Billion to Settle Marketing Case
headline.print_headline: Pfizer to Pay $2.3 Billion to Settle Inquiry Over Marketing
